title: Tottenham cancel press conference after boss Mauricio Pochettino leaves training ground early with illness

text:
The Spurs boss was due to hold a press conference ahead of the FA Cup
Mauricio Pochettino had to leave Tottenham's training ground early on Thursday after being struck down by illness.
The Spurs boss was due to hold a pre-match press conference ahead of their trip to Colchester in the FA Cup fourth round on Saturday.
But Pochettino was forced to cancel speaking to the media after coming down with a virus.
Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino left the club's training ground early after falling ill

Tottenham will hope their manager can recover in time for their lunch-time kick-off at Colchester in two days.
Pochettino was due to shed light on where Spurs stand in their search for a striker, with only a week to go in the January transfer window.
Tottenham have made no secret about wanting to buy back-up for Harry Kane, who is unlikely to start on Saturday.
Pochettino made wholesale changes for Tottenham's FA Cup third round meetings against Leicester with Kane starting neither of the ties.
